headline: CSX working with Goldman Sachs to explore strategic options, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Union Pacific said on Tuesday it would buy smaller rival Norfolk Southern in an $85 billion deal to create the first U.S. coast-to-coast freight rail operator and reshape the movement of goods from grains to autos across the country.  Goldman Sachs did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.

headline: Hub Group Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Highlights: GAAP diluted earnings per share (EPS) of $0.42 for the second quarterSecond quarter revenue of $905.6 millionNon-GAAP adjusted EPS of $0.45, which excludes adjustments for vendor settlements in the quarter Operating income of $34 million or 3.8% of revenue, adjusted operating income (non-GAAP) of $36.9 million or 4.1% of revenue Returned $29 million to shareholders year-to-date through dividend payments of $15 million and stock repurchases of $14 millionStrong balance sheet with net

headline: Rail deal will open new markets for top US container port
summary: The Port of Los Angeles is poised to reap the benefits of Union Pacific’s acquisition of Norfolk Southern, its top executive says. The post Rail deal will open new markets for top US container port appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Schneider National not yet choosing sides on potential changes in railroad landscape
summary: Schneider National said Thursday it needs more information before weighing in on the potential fallout from a Union Pacific–Norfolk Southern merger. The post Schneider National not yet choosing sides on potential changes in railroad landscape appeared first on FreightWaves.
